stories.text: What are your expectations when using cloud functions? What's missing in today's landscape of cloud functions providers?
stories.title: Ask HN: What's missing for you in today's cloud functions?
App and lab kit can turn your phone into a Covid-19 and flu virus detection test
Technocratic domination: when government funds science, it controls science
Covid-19: Deficiency of Vitamin D associated with disease severity and mortality
How Apple's privacy push cost Meta $10bn

stories.text:
In the old days, corporate rebels could almost secretly run special projects to create new and innovative software.

Modern software processes make this impossible. It would be deeply frowned upon, likely a sacking offence, to create software outside the tightly controlled process.

Does this mean anything? I don’t know. But what it does mean is any company that runs an organized process has no chance of “random innovation”. That concept, which was common in “the old days”, is gone.

Modern organized software development kills innovation.
